Bring your laptops

events.name: Hacktoberfest 2019 - Open Hack Day
events.description:
Hacktoberfest 2019 celebrates the spirit of open source and invites aspiring and enthusiastic programmers to contribute to Open Source. Hacktoberfest 2019 is powered to you by DigitalOcean with DEV. The event is open for the month of October.

Maintainers can help emerging programmers to become contributors by letting them help code their open-source projects. Contributors get an amazing opportunity to work on real-world projects in a collaborative manner.

From translations to bug fixes to writing documentation updates, each contribution counts.

To qualify for the official limited edition Hacktoberfest shirt, you must register and make four pull requests (PRs) between October 1-31 (in any time zone).

GDG Bhopal will help you get started with Hacktoberfest 2019, and the culture of Open Source.

It's Hacktoberfest 2019! Let's celebrate open source over food, drinks, learning, and great company!

Refer for details: https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/

The event starts on October 20, 2019 ‚Äî 10 AM to 2 PM.

Agenda:
10:00 AM ‚Äî Hacking Starts
10:15 AM ‚Äî Introduction to Hacktoberfest 2019 (Session)
10:45 AM ‚Äî Introduction to Git (Session)
12:00 PM ‚Äî Getting Started with Open Source (Session)
12:30 PM ‚Äî Lunch Time
01:00 PM ‚Äî PR Time (Live Coding)
02:00 PM ‚Äî Wrap Up

What to bring?
Your laptop and charger would be good enough.

Code of Conduct
Refer to the link for more details - https://do.co/hacktoberconduct

events.name: Android Track: Introduction to Android Programming (01)
events.description:
At Google Developers Group Bhopal, we're getting started with our new initiative to develop the Bhopal Community further with support from our Community Volunteers and Resources provided to us, by Google and our Partners.

We're introducing Tracks to GDG Bhopal, as an effort to accelerate outcome-based learning.

This session is the first in many for every learner interested in the "Android Track", that will take place with Java and Kotlin.

The Android Track will cover a beginner's journey from creating their first app to distributing their app to Play Store.

We will cover the following topics through this journey:
01. Building Layouts
02. Making App Interactive
03. Intents and Activities
04. Data, Loops and Custom Classes
05. Audio and Libraries
06. Navigation Patterns Using Fragments
07. JSON Parsing
08. HTTP Networking (HttpUrlConnection class)
09. Threads and Parallelism (AsyncTask, Loaders and Shared Preferences)
10. Using SQLite
11. ContentProvider Class
12. Using a CursorAdapter and CursorLoader
13. Location API
14. Sensors
15. Distribution with Play Store

To get enrolled in the Android Track, please proceed to register on the form at http://bit.ly/gdgbpl_android and get registered now!

____________________________________________

LEARN MORE ABOUT TRACKS BELOW
____________________________________________

What are Tracks?

‚Ä¢ Tracks are continuous sessions about a specific technology.
‚Ä¢ The focus will be on learning the technology in-depth.
‚Ä¢ The sessions will go on with specific topics.
‚Ä¢ Each topic will have a real-life project tied to it, to learn practically.

How to register for Tracks?
‚Ä¢ You'll register for our Track with the Google Form.
‚Ä¢ Each Track stretches for about 6-8 sessions.
‚Ä¢ You'll be informed when you're shortlisted, based on your application.
‚Ä¢ If you're shortlisted, you can start attending all the sessions for the same.

What will happen in Tracks?

‚Ä¢ The Trainer in each track will be a notable expert from the industry.
‚Ä¢ The Learners in each track will be organized into Study Buddy groups, to help each other out.
‚Ä¢ A Volunteer will be assigned to each Study Buddy group, who will keep track of your progress.
‚Ä¢ A reference course will be given, to help you get back on par with other learners if you miss out on a session.
‚Ä¢ Occasional Q&A sessions will take place to help you clear your doubts, and learn from more people from the industry.

What are the benefits of Tracks?

‚Ä¢ Project and Outcome-based Learning from Industry Experts.
‚Ä¢ Hiring Opportunities from IT Companies at the end of each track.
‚Ä¢ Internship Opportunities from budding Startups and IT Companies at the end of each track.
‚Ä¢ You can showcase your Project, to community guys, IT Companies and to Recruiters.
‚Ä¢ You can participate in an exclusive Hackathon with Google Developers Group.
‚Ä¢ Exclusive Swags and Resources from the Google Community.
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to meet famed figures of the industry through your project.

Hop into the bandwagon now! The Community is here.

events.name: Getting into Google Summer of Code - GSoC 2020
events.description:
Google Summer of Code is a global program focused on bringing more student developers into open source software development. Students work with an open-source organization on a 3-month programming project during their break from school.

Getting into this coveted open-source program seems like a daunting challenge to students around the world.

GDG Bhopal is here with a concise webinar, where we'll discuss the real experiences, the practical advice and answers to our questions regarding the same from past GSoC students.

On March 29, we're organizing the "Getting into GSoC 2020" webinar with Akshat Bahety, who completed his GSoC program in 2018, with his project "Code Better" with the organization, PMD.

Join us to learn more about this program that will surely teach you more about collaborative development in the real world.

The link to join the webinar will be shared in your mail, on a first come first serve basis due to a limitation of 100 participants.

If you're not able to join, a recording through YouTube will be shared to you.

events.name: Getting Started with Git - Hands-on with Progate
events.description:
Version Control is a powerful tool for developers to collaborate and code. Git is one of the pioneer tools in this field. Learning Git opens new horizons to collaborate with developers around the world, via open source.

We are organizing a Hands-On Session on Getting Started with Version Control using Git and GitHub, taken by Sheeraz Ali. We are partnering with Progate to provide a Hands-On experience using their awesome platform.

|| BEFORE THE SESSION üë©‚Äçüíª ||

‚Ä¢ You need to join the Progate platform from the link to code with us ‚Äî http://bit.ly/gdgbhopalgitprogate

‚Ä¢ You should complete the "Command Line" lessons from here, after that ‚Äî https://progate.com/lessons/commandline/study/1

‚Ä¢ Please join ONLY from your laptop/desktop for a better experience.

|| ABOUT üòé ||

Sheeraz Ali is an entrepreneur with almost 2 yrs of experience in Network, Mobile, Application, and Linux Security and Web Development. Sheeraz is also an open-source supporter and has supported multiple open-source projects, prominent of them being Owasp Cheat Sheet and Awesome Hacking Repository.

|| GRATITUDE üå∏ ||

A big thank you to Progate, for supporting our community. Thanks to Facebook DevC Bhopal, and Brainless Coders Community for helping in the outreach.

events.name: Open Source 101 with GSoCers
events.description:
Linux, Git, Android, Mozilla, PHP, Python, Chromium are renowned instances of open-source software built with contributors around the globe. But, what is open-source?

Get ready to get all your questions answered, and getting started with contributing to open source yourself, with GDG Bhopal's Open Source 101 webinar.

We have 3 amazing guests with us, who have been open source contributors, and were even a part of Google's coveted Summer of Code program through various organizations - Ayush Bhardwaj
(GSoC[masked], Fossology), Kaushlendra Pratap (GSoC 2020, Fossology) and Sahil Jha (GSoC 2020, NRNB).

We will learn the philosophy behind open source, how to contribute to open source organizations today, and how to get started with your first contribution.

upcoming.name: Online Safety for You: A Women-focused Workshop
upcoming.description:
If you haven't filled the form yet, please fill the form at https://bit.ly/gdgbpl-safety

The form is required and should be filled, before attending this GIRLS-ONLY session.

Have you ever received a message that doesn't give you a good vibe?

Or have you ever felt that your data is being retrieved without your consent?

What you do when you experience something like this, disconnect from social media or change the content you share online?

Remember you are not alone. Many face the same.

And, it's high time, we stop taking a step back from social media.
Rather it's time to speak up and discuss ways in which we can protect and defend ourself online.

So, we are taking an initiative to start a conversation about Women's Online Safety with "Online Safety for You".
It's a GIRLS-ONLY session which focuses on discussion about being safe online.

We realise that this might not be the ideal conversation topic. Some of you might be emotionally uncomfortable. And, to make this a safe comfortable space for conversations to flow, we have invited Ms Chahak Chugh, a Mental Health Speaker, who's been vocal about these consequential issues.

Along with her, we have invited Mr Sameer Khan, Co-Organizer, GDG Bhopal, who is bringing resources from the Women Techmakers Community of Google, along with studies from Jigsaw, an Alphabet company focused on making the web safer for everyone, and learnings from activists and speakers such as Ms Rana Abdelhamid.

Join this GIRLS-ONLY session to keep yourself safer online. The link to attend the session on Google Meet will be sent in the mail to you and on our WhatsApp Group.

organizers.name: Sameer K.
